definition: (bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither

sentences.english: See more photos of Jeremy Lutes's work .
sentences.chinese: 见张照片的杰里鲁特琴的工作。

sentences.english: Nor will the lute sound at the twilight hour.
sentences.chinese: 鲁特琴也不会在黄昏时刻响起了。

sentences.english: He idly plucked the strings of the lute.
sentences.chinese: 他漫不经心地拨弄着鲁特琴的琴弦。

sentences.english: My liege, I have little money and no possessions save a peasant-grade lute.
sentences.chinese: 阁下，我没钱没财产只有这个农民的鲁特琴。

definition: Niccolò Paganini (1782-1840), Italian violinist and composer
plucked string or stringed instrument/plucked instrument
bassoon (loanword)/also written 巴頌管|巴颂管[ba1 song4 guan3] or 低音管[di1 yin1 guan3]
Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
